title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: The Massachusetts public defender work stoppage began in May to demand higher pay, resulting in over 900 defendants without representation.
The Supreme Judicial Court is considering if it can order temporary pay raises for court-appointed attorneys to resolve the work stoppage.
In August, Massachusetts lawmakers approved a 30% pay increase for bar advocates, but representation issues for defendants persist.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston for a book signing and private dinner.
She signed her New York Times bestselling thriller, 'Gone Before Goodbye,' co-authored by Harlan Coben.
Witherspoon also participated in a discussion at Harvard Business School, reflecting on her 'Legally Blonde' film.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, a Springfield-based aide to Gov. Healey, was arrested for trafficking cocaine to a state office building.
Republican lawmakers are demanding details about the vetting process that led to Cook's 2023 hiring.
Gov. Healey's aides faced scrutiny due to Cook's previous charges, including a 2001 assault and firearms offenses.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two teens, Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, were killed in a New Bedford crash.
A 2019 Honda Civic crashed on Route 140 South around 2 a.m.; both teens were ejected and pronounced dead.
The driver, an 18-year-old from Dartmouth, survived with non-life-threatening injuries; crash investigation is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos of a suspect involved in downtown commercial burglaries since August 21.
The suspect has used a pry tool to steal credit cards, cash, and electronics from businesses overnight.
Police departments at Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University report similar incidents linked to the suspect.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Tennessee Titans reportedly refused to trade with the Patriots due to personal issues with coach Mike Vrabel.
Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk didn't want to assist Vrabel's new team after his firing in 2023.
Mike Vrabel joined the Patriots as head coach after a consulting role with the Cleveland Browns following his Tennessee exit.

title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Josh Minott scored a career-high 21 points in the Celtics' 136-107 win over the Washington Wizards.
Minott, previously with the Timberwolves, earned a starting role with the Celtics after signing a two-year deal.
Teammate Jaylen Brown praised Minott's energy and defensive impact, noting it strengthens the team's performance.

title: Are the New England Patriots back? Hereâ€™s what 200 readers said.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: New England Patriots are on a six-game win streak but face scrutiny over their opponents' strength.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye is a potential MVP candidate, impressing fans with his performance.
Informal poll shows 43% believe Patriots are back, 44% say it's too early to tell, 13% hold reservations.

title: Questions swirl after bus aide allegedly assaults autistic student from Cambridge
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A video captured an aide allegedly restraining an autistic student and calling him 'the devil' on a Cambridge school bus.
The aide was placed on leave, and the Department of Children and Families is investigating the incident.
The Cambridge Public School system removed the aide from transporting students and is seeking high care standards from NRT.

title: Patriots owner Robert Kraft named a semifinalist for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame Class
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Robert Kraft advances to semifinal round for 2026 Pro Football Hall of Fame in contributor category.
Selection committee will review semifinalists in virtual meeting on November 11; finalist announced in February.
Kraft, 84, evaluated 13 times, could join former Patriots coach Bill Belichick if both reach finalist stage.
